law.catch_line: A project qualifies as a solar energy project if it:...

text.section:
A project qualifies as a solar energy project if it:
is an addition, alteration, or improvement to a residential building or a commercial building; and
is designed to reduce the energy requirements of the building by using:
wind energy;
energy from a wood-burning appliance; or
solar energy of:
the active type based on mechanically forced energy transfer;
the passive type based on convective, conductive, or radiant energy transfer; or
a combination of these types.

A solar energy project may include:
a solar process heat device;
a solar electric device; and
an earth sheltered building in which the sheltering substantially reduces the consumption of energy by the building.
A solar energy project may not include a fireplace, unless the fireplace is an integral part of a system designed to use passive solar energy.
